intro: Osmia smilacina, commonly known as the smilacine bee. It is a species of bee belonging to the family Megachilidae, known for its distinctive appearance and ecological role. This plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Osmia smilacina plays an important role in pollination and is often found in association with other native flora in its habitat.
